definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
twenty (20), in a limited number of set expressions/also written using banker's character 念
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
lit. to gaze at the ocean and lament one's inadequacy (idiom)/fig. to feel powerless and incompetent (to perform a task)

sentences.english: The breath goes now, and some say no;
sentences.chinese: 嘆其氣絕魂離，亦有說不然。

sentences.english: The old woman sighed out her grief.
sentences.chinese: 老婦人嘆着氣敘說她的悲哀。

sentences.english: And prison sentences have become longer, he lamented.
sentences.chinese: 監獄刑期也變長了，他嘆道。

sentences.english: Thousands of events in the past pours into my mind. By toasting the void, I lament the bygone heroes.
sentences.chinese: 數千年往事注到心頭，把酒凌虛，嘆滾滾英雄誰在？

sentences.english: He sighed, and concluded, "Even with love."
sentences.chinese: 他嘆了口氣，總結道，“甚至是愛。”

sentences.english: However, we never praise cults for they encourage people to commit wrongdoings.
sentences.chinese: 如果是叫人造罪業墮三途的邪教，我們絕對不讚嘆。

sentences.english: I sighed and edged into bed next to him.
sentences.chinese: 我嘆了口氣，貼着他擠上了牀。

sentences.english: Li sighed - this was the last message she wanted to receive.
sentences.chinese: 李紅豔嘆了口氣，這是她最不想收到的微信。

sentences.english: With a sigh she walked back to her other students who were clustered at the back table patiently waiting her return.
sentences.chinese: 她嘆了口氣，回到後排那一羣正耐心等著她的學生。

sentences.english: Martin heaved a great sigh of envy.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁長長地嘆了一口氣，心裏很羨慕。

sentences.english: Looking at the night sky, bright stars who don't admire infinite universe?
sentences.chinese: 遙望星光燦爛的夜空，誰不讚嘆宇宙的無窮？

sentences.english: Darky heaved a sigh for him.
He sighs, and wipes stray bread crumbs from his beard, rising to his cloven feet.
sentences.chinese: 他嘆了口氣，抹掉沾在鬍子上的麪包屑，翹起二郎腿。

sentences.english: She sighs and stands up, weakly.
sentences.chinese: 她嘆了口氣站了起來，很虛弱。

sentences.english: Why is it necessary to sigh-off gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 人生能有幾回搏，君子何須嘆離合。

definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
